page.title: 02Fawley Church
page.content: Fawley Church is very old the Normans built it in 971 A.D. The oldest piece of furniture is a paten which was given to the church by the Bishop of Winchester in 1350.The church was the largest place in the village of Fawley.They held many things there like,school lessons,parties and even markets.After the market they lifted up the pews and put all the mess the animals made into a hole under the floor. Of the many tombstones which may be seen in the churchyard one belongs to a local hero called Samuel Kinkead who whilst trying to break the air speed record lost his life.In the church there is a seventeenth century chest which was used to keep official documents.In the second world war the church was bombed but by luck it survived.
